com.terei.jvector
Class JVector

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      com.terei.jvector.JVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public class JVector
extends JFrame
implements ActionListener

This is the main class for the JVector project. This project aims to create a vector based paint program, for more details, see the documentation that should have accompinied this source code. This class initializes the program and provides the GUI frontend of the porgram.

Since:
19/04/2004 (dd/mm/yyyy)
Version:
1
Author:
David Terei
See Also:
Serialized Form

createTool

private JButton createTool(String icon_name,
                           String TipReference,
                           Tool tool)
Creates a Tool with the paramaters specified.

Parameters:
icon_name - The Icon for the Tool.
TipReference - The mouse over ToolTip for the tool (appears in status bar). This is just the string that is used in the locale file to identify it. Its key value.
tool - Which tool this tool is.
Returns:
A Tool Bar Button.

createToolListener

private ActionListener createToolListener(Tool tool2)
Creates an Action listener for a tool button, that notifies the MapInterface class of a tool change.

Parameters:
tool2 - The tool that this listener will activate when called.
Returns:
An ActionListener that will set the tool to the one with the value specified.
See Also:
PaintTab.setTool(Tool)

createDeleteListener

private ActionListener createDeleteListener()
Creates a listener for a shape deletion tool, that deletes the currently selected shape.

Returns:
An action listener

initExtraBar

private void initExtraBar()
Initialises the extra tool bar. This method needs to be called only once at the start, after that, setupExtraBar() should be called.

setupExtraBar

private void setupExtraBar()
Setups the extra tool bar which contains the colour chooser and the tool options bar. This method should be called every time the Extra Bar is modified.

getToolOptionBar

private JPanel getToolOptionBar()
Creates the jpanel to add to the extra tool bar which contains the various options for the currently selected tool.

Returns:
A JPanel that contains various options for the current tool.
See Also:
ShapeManager

setupTabbedPane

private void setupTabbedPane()
seups the tabbed pane which holds all the open images currently being worked on.

loadImageIcon

public static ImageIcon loadImageIcon(String path)
Loads an image icon in a way that allows for the application to be stored in a rar or nativley compiled, as well as run as just plain class files.

Parameters:
path - The path, relative to the working directory, to the image.
Returns:
The image icon.

newImage

public void newImage(String name,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int zoom,
                     Shape[] shapes)
Creates a new Image/Canvas.

Parameters:
name - The name of the image
x - The width of the image
y - The height of the image
zoom - The current zoom level
shapes - An array of shapes to add to the new image.

saveImage

private void saveImage()
Saves the currently selected image to JVectors native format.

See Also:
saveImageAs(), ImageFile, PaintCanvas.getImage()

saveImageAs

private void saveImageAs()
Saves the currently selected image to JVectors native format, launching a JFileChooser that allows the user to select the output file.

See Also:
saveImage(), ImageFile, PaintCanvas.getImage()

openImage

private void openImage()
Opens up a pre existing image from the local disc, launching a file chooser dialog to find the file.

openImage

private void openImage(String path)
Opens up a pre existing image from the local disc.

Parameters:
path - The path to the image to open.

close

private void close()
Closes the currently selected image, checking if the image has been modified since the last save, and if so, launching a "Do You Want to Save..." dialog.

export

private void export()
Exports the current image to a different file type.
